name: Manager removes himself from org via **CLI**
description:
- Login with valid credentials via **UI**.
- Get Bearer auth token from Playwright local storage.
- Create new organization via **API**.
- Signup `second user` via **UI**.
- Login with Bearer auth token via **CLI**.
- Add `second user` to organization with `Manager` role via **CLI**.
- `Second user` login with Bearer auth token via **CLI**.

### Verify that:

- `Manager` **cannot** remove `himself` from organization via **CLI**.
descriptionHtml:
• Login with valid credentials via UI.
  • Get Bearer auth token from Playwright local storage.
  • Create new organization via API.
  • Signup second user via UI.
  • Login with Bearer auth token via CLI.
  • Add second user to organization with Manager role via CLI.
  • Second user login with Bearer auth token via CLI.

Verify that:

  • Manager cannot remove himself from organization via CLI.

steps.name: Verify Apolo CLI client is installed

testStage.description:
- Login with valid credentials via **UI**.
- Get Bearer auth token from Playwright local storage.
- Create new organization via **API**.
- Signup `second user` via **UI**.
- Login with Bearer auth token via **CLI**.
- Add `second user` to organization with `Manager` role via **CLI**.
- `Second user` login with Bearer auth token via **CLI**.

### Verify that:

- `Manager` **cannot** remove `himself` from organization via **CLI**.
testStage.descriptionHtml:
• Login with valid credentials via UI.
  • Get Bearer auth token from Playwright local storage.
  • Create new organization via API.
  • Signup second user via UI.
  • Login with Bearer auth token via CLI.
  • Add second user to organization with Manager role via CLI.
  • Second user login with Bearer auth token via CLI.

Verify that:

  • Manager cannot remove himself from organization via CLI.

AssertionError: [AssertionError] during step: Remove user from organization via CLI
Message: Expected: 
ERROR: Illegal argument(s) (Org users cannot remove themselves) 
but got 
Your root certificates are out of date.
You are using certifi 2025.7.14, however 2025.8.3 is available.
Please consider upgrading certifi package, e.g.:
    python -m pip install --upgrade certifi
or
    conda update certifi
